text: Not sure I fully follow, maybe you mean something like generate fields via some graphical interface?

Hi team, question:

Is there a way to conditionally add modules to a dynamic page? Dynamic pages are generated by the information that comes from the hubdb table, I wonder if there is a way to render X module on X generated page.

I understand that I could add a column in the hubdb table where the content creator, using a boolean, could select which page to render the module on, but the problem I see is that it should also have columns so that the content creator can fill that module with information.

Is there a simpler way that I don’t know of to do this?

If you mean a marketer could view a dynamic page in the editor and add a module to a particular _instance_ (row) ... this is not possible currently.

However you could as you say bake into the data structure of the table information that the dynamic page logic could use to pull in a particular module.
That’s what I was afraid of, as I mentioned before, the problem with this is that I need to add extra columns for each field that the module has, but I’ll take that approach then, thanks Byron.

hello! I have a sandbox account to test cms-react components and I'm getting a weird error that is preventing scripts from a component inside an island to run.
It runs when I preview inside HubSpot edit page, but when I preview the page on a new window this error throws. (chrome)

(this was working fine last week, not sure what changed)

> Access to script at 'about:blank' (redirected from '<https://static.hsappstatic.net/cms-js-static/ex/js/island-runtime/v1/island-runtime.mjs>') from origin '<https://45945020.hs-sites.com>' has been blocked by CORS policy: Cross origin requests are only supported for protocol schemes: http, data, isolated-app, chrome-extension, chrome, https, chrome-untrusted.
:warning:  this is also happening on production for us :point_up:
can you provide a link to the production case
Yes, I have already an HubSpot website and will convert them to cms-react. The fields already excised
after updating chrome the issue went away. Possibly a chrome bug
